WordsClass.Definition: to leave somebody, especially somebody you are responsible for, with no intention of returning
able to do something (used as a modal verb) to have the skill, intelligence, opportunity, etc. needed to do something
a little more or less than; a little before or after
to respect somebody for what they have done or to respect their qualities
a room in which there is a bath/ bathtub, a washbasin and often a toilet
a device that is placed inside a car engine, clock, radio, etc. and that produces the electricity that makes it work
the first meal of the day
thick strong metal rope used on ships, for supporting bridges, etc.
to use numbers to find out a total number, amount, distance, etc.
cancel something to decide that something that has been arranged will not now take place
charge (for something) the amount of money that somebody asks for goods and services
costing little money or less money than you expected
a small round solid piece of medicine that you swallow
happening at the end of a long process
